snippet: The fourth quarter was the first without patent protection for both Pfizer and its blockbuster cholesterol drug Lipitor, and Lilly, which markets Zyprexa, long its biggest product.
abstract: Competition for low-cost generic drugs squeezes quarterly profits at Pfizer Inc and Eli Lilly & Company, but both pharmaceutical makers are able to beat forecasts; Pfizer’s fourth-quarter net income fell 50 percent, to $1.44 billion, or 19 cents a share, compared with $2.89 billion, or 36 cents a share, in the period a year earlier; Lilly's fourth-quarter net income fell 27 percent, to $858.2 million, or 77 cents a share, compared with $1.17 billion, or $1.05 a share, in the period a year earlier.
lead_paragraph: The fourth quarter was the first without patent protection for both Pfizer and its blockbuster cholesterol drug Lipitor, and Lilly, which markets Zyprexa, long its biggest product.

headline.seo: Pfizer and Eli Lilly, Squeezed by Generics, Top Forecasts
headline.main: Pfizer and Eli Lilly, Squeezed by Generics, Beat Forecasts
headline.print_headline: Pfizer and Eli Lilly, Squeezed by Generics, Beat Forecasts
